explanation.overview: 这三个词都表示‘禁止’，但用法和语气有细微差别。

details.meaning: 通常用于正式或口语中，表示某人有权力或权威不允许某事发生。
details.example: The teacher forbids students from using phones in class.（老师禁止学生在课堂上使用手机。）

details.meaning: 通常指官方或法律层面禁止某物或某行为，较为正式，强调完全禁止。
details.example: The government banned smoking in public places.（政府禁止在公共场所吸烟。）

details.meaning: 正式用词，多用于法律、规章制度，强调不允许某行为发生。
details.example: The school prohibits students from cheating on exams.（学校禁止学生考试作弊。）

comparison_table.prohibit: 正式法律意义上的禁止

comparison_table.forbid: Parents forbid children to stay out late.
comparison_table.prohibit: The law prohibits texting while driving.

life_examples.forbid: Teachers forbid students to use phones during tests.
life_examples.ban: The school banned smoking on campus.
life_examples.prohibit: The school prohibits bringing pets to class.

common_errors.error: ❌ The law forbids smoking in all public areas.
common_errors.correction: ✅ The law bans smoking in all public areas.（法律文件中通常用 ban 或 prohibit。）

common_errors.error: ❌ The teacher banned us from talking.
common_errors.correction: ✅ The teacher forbids us from talking.（老师一般用 forbid 来表达禁止学生行为。）

mini_test.question: 选择正确答案：The government ___ the sale of alcohol to minors.
选择正确答案：My parents ___ me from staying out late.
选择正确答案：The city ___ smoking in parks.

additional_notes.tip: forbid 重主观禁止，ban 强调官方全面禁止，prohibit 多用于法律和正式文档。
